visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color for the title, a medium blue color for the axis labels, and a light blue color for the data labels. Font size for the title should be 20px, for axis labels 14px, and for data labels 12px. Data series: The series should represent the monthly average temperature with data points for each month from January to December. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the line. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color, enable y-axis zooming, and display a legend with the series name 'Temperature'.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart displaying the monthly average temperature. The chart type is set to 'line' with y-axis zooming enabled. The chart title is styled with a dark blue color and a font size of 20px, while the axis labels and titles are styled with a medium blue color and a font size of 14px. The data labels are styled with a light blue color and a font size of 12px. The data series represents the monthly average temperature from January to December, with a gradient color from light blue to dark blue for the line. The chart background is set to a light gray color, and the legend is enabled with the series name 'Temperature'. This configuration ensures a visually appealing and informative chart that meets the specified requirements.
